comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Audience at the unveiling of the Partridge statue of Thomas Jefferson, which was presented to Columbia University by Ralph Pulitzer, in a ceremony in front of the Columbia School of Journalism. The ceremony took place during Commencement Week, on June 2, 1914.

Other Bain/LOC photos of the unveiling ceremony:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan and rjones0856: Thanks for the information and the gathering of related photographs. The statue, a gift of the Joseph Pulitzer estate, was actually unveiled in a ceremony on June 2, rather than on Commencement Day, per this New York Times article. We will add these details to this record and to the other related photographs when we update.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: And, thanks for pointing out the camera "in action"!   A very unusual subject, so added a tag. -- Helena
